comments.commentBody: Deaf ears, NYTimes, deaf ears.

The lessons to be learned are the greatest benefits of the entire trump debacle.

Political correctness is common decency. Will that lesson be learned?

White patriarchy is primitive and obsolete. Will that lesson be learned? If so, trump will teach us that, not Hillary.

Hillary Clinton is no Girl Scout or Shrinking Violet, and this is not her first rodeo. Let her go into the remaining
debates and the final weeks of the campaign prepared to go toe to toe with Mr. Trump and label him the crude lout and pathetic loser he plainly is. Anything less would be a cruel disappointment to American women and girls over the mental age of 12 who want and need to see him shamed, publicly humiliated and run out of town on a rail.

I have listened to the tape and as a man this is conversations some of us have. The comments were very crude, even for my tastes, but this was a private conversation between guys. Come on! I hate Donald Trump, but releasing this tape is a low blow. Unfortunately, men have some very lewd conversations in private and I don't have a problem with that. This is talk, men talk junk, as a man I'll let him slide on this. Women will find this offensive because it was not meant for thier ears. This conversation should never have been released or recorded for that matter. In full disclosure, I will not vote for Trump, but I don't approve of low ball tactics like this, especially between men. Not cool!

My thirteen-year old daughter wonders who speaks for this man. She wonders what kind of people inhabit her classrooms, our parks, and the neighborhood we live in that would stand by a man who routinely denigrates women, insults them, and now -- on an open mic, makes statements that are tantamount to an admission of sexual assault. Although she cannot vote, she hopes that others will have the judgment to speak responsibly on her behalf.

It seems odd to her, and to me as her father, that a man who has such plain hostility towards women could receive so much support from the American public. It is frightening because what other behavior will we then condone? Is there a spectrum of sexual assault or misconduct that is ‘acceptable’ because Donald Trump makes it so?

It is very hard to reconcile this reality for my daughter — not just because Trump is a boor, but because so many in America are still willing to look the other way. In not too long, she will leave this house, and enter the world, and take her place in American society. In Trump’s America, she’s a ‘dog’, she’s a ‘slob’, or something worse — and the lingering doubt in her mind and mine is who will stand up to men like Trump if we fail to do it now.

My agenda is not Clinton versus Trump, Democrat versus Republican, or Conservative versus Liberal. I just wonder — is there any shame left in America, or have we completely forgotten what we once aspired to be?

I no longer recognize my country. And I miss it.

I am a Republican and my first choice for '16 Was Jeb. When it turned out my party picked a man I could in no way support, I decided to vote for Hillary. If this latest example of Trump's terrible character & fitness does not cause my party to disavow this man and his candidacy en mass, I will simply leave the Party for good.

I am left to wonder which I find more despicable: Trump's filthy mind and mouth and morals or the deafening silence of McConnell, Ryan, and other GOP cowards who say things like "He shouldn't say that, but I still endorse him and want him to be our president."
At long last have they NO shame at all?

240 years of this country. People who believed in and fought for its existence and we have come to this. A crass buffoon and an ignorant electorate willing to sell its soul to a con man who has never done anything for anyone but himself. Who makes promises that he has neither the intelligence or will to implement. We should weep for every brave man and woman whom sacrificed for this country and its people.

Has the bar for what is acceptable in a President ever been lower than it is today?  Exactly how classy does President Obama seem right about now?  The republican party should sever all ties to Donald Trump TODAY if they want to retain even a shred of credibility.  Can anyone even imagine Obama (or Hillary for that matter) bragging about grabbing women by the crotch and getting away with it because of their celebrity status?  No.  The idea is absurd.
His supporters won't care. He'll blame "the media" and "Bill Clinton." Then we'll be on to the next thing.
Trump didn't say he could grab women between their legs, he said he could grab them by the pussy. You need to say it. The Republican nominee said it. Don't clean it up.

The Republican party needs to take a long shower and wash the filth off.  Then they need to stare in the mirror for a few months (or years) to figure out just what they want to be.  This is the inevitable product of lowest-common-denominator thinking and reliance on their base, which could only be consolidated by appealing to the basest of instincts.  Those evangelicals sticking by the Donald need to count up how many faces they have.  A minimum of 2, to be sure.  The folks in the basket (whatever size it is)- stay there and don't come out again.
I was a high school and college athlete and I never, ever heard these kind of comments. This is not locker room banter, this is a man without a single redeeming quality.

Mr. Trump is the only member of the GOP who has actually been honest about who he is over the past year...the fact that all the others have silently, or some of them even vocally, supported him during that same time now appears to have shown us how honest they have been about who they are.

Thank you for this editorial.

Perhaps I have led a sheltered life, but I have never heard such vile thoughts expressed by any public figure. And the flat "if I offended anyone" apology that dodged any responsibility and showed zero understanding of how vile and offensive those comments were, only made them worse.

As a woman and an American, I am especially saddened by the prospect that some of my fellow citizens will undoubtedly still vote for Donald Trump--not because they agree with these comments (I still trust that that contingent is tiny) but because they don't consider such vileness a disqualification for the U.S. Presidency.

Mr. Trump's utter contempt for women--talking about them with such vulgarity and treating them as either potential sexual conquests, as "dogs" unworthy of basic human respect, or as hags lacking stamina--is revolting. The notion that some of my fellow citizens consider his speech simply immature locker-room talk or lack of polish that can be "out-weighed" by other factors is almost as nauseating, and also makes me terribly sad.

I am nonetheless optimistic that there are enough honorable American men and women who consider Mr. Trump's words and behavior unacceptable; and that they will reject him when they have an opportunity to make their voices heard: at the ballot box.

I did not support Trump for president. I am a registered Democrat and I have never liked Donald Trump, never found him amusing nor entertaining.

However, I actually hope he does not step down. I hope he continues to run for president. No one has charged him with rape or sexual assault. No one has filed charges against him. (He probably had every woman he has assaulted sign a legal non-disclosure agreement. He is very fond of those.)

It will, I hope, hurt his chances. It will, I hope, help Hillary and the other candidates for president. I suppose this is very cynical of me. I like Hillary running against Trump because Trump's appeal is limited. He has his avid supporters and his reluctant supporters. I am in the group of Hillary supporters who actually like her. I have never hated her.
Apology not accepted.

Trump was an old stag showing off before the young buck, but we need an evolved human being representing us in the White House.

Both his ego-driven business and his private behavior model serious current problems of our country. We deserve someone of better character making critical Presidential decisions and appearing nightly on televisions around the world.

Men often talk like this. I used to talk like this. But I outgrew it sometime around the time I fell in love with my wife. I think that's true of most men, but not Donald. Perhaps he's never really fallen in love with anyone except himself.

What frightens me the most, as a 69 year old woman who has heard all of this from men not running for president, all of my life, is that it reflects a continuing, deep mysogyny in this country and we women are surrounded by it, every day of our lives. And yes, it is hidden behind fake behavior to our faces, as it was in the transcript while  behind our backs they demean us. It frightens me that men are not the only mysogynists either.  The women standing behind Trump screaming in approval at his rallies are enablers and just as guilty of dragging this country publicly into the gutter.

His inner circle can spin this anyway they want and Trump can say whatever he wants but there is no dodging the facts. I couldn't help wondering why this video was any different than the multitude of other statements he has regularly made about women. Was it the use of the word "pussy" or the very graphic picture that it evokes of him crotch-grabbing your daughter, your wife, your mother, or your grandmother?

There is no apologizing for this at the age of 70. When will people realize that the video clip is who he is...there is no changing the true nature of a person at this late stage.

And he still thinks he is running against Bill Clinton, someone should remind him he is running against a woman.

There was one thing that Trump was probably factually correct about. And that is that Bill Clinton had said things to him on the golf course that were allot worse. It would also not be unfair to assume that Clinton too was referring to actions of his, just as Trump was.
And the fact is that if a recording of Clinton talking that same manner of "locker room talk" came to light, or if somebody that had heard him speaking that way decided to tell the public about it, we would not as a nation completely reassess who Clinton is and was, or retroactively downgrade his whole presidency. In fact since these revelations would not be in regard to a presidential candidate they would not even be major news, as it would not come as a surprise to most people.
And the same is true about Trump. That while it merits being "major news" to be discussed and dissected by the media because of its relevance to the presidential race, most people are not all surprised by it at all. Just about anyone who hears of this views it as as a story about a recording surfacing at one of the worst possible moments in what is the game of the race for president.
That the significance this holds for most Americans is all in the recording being discovered is a game changer in an exciting competition that has the nation is focused on. This is quite similar to an interception in an important and close football game in the 4th quarter.

No, on every count. I'm a 58 year-old man and have had my share of locker room conversations and outgrew this kind of conversation at 17. Beyond adolescence only the losers in the group talk that way and the rest cringe when they hear it. Further, this could hardly be called private -- he was talking with a member of the press. And if fairness is your concern, recognize that if a tape of Hillary Clinton disrespecting all men surfaced, it would run on Fox 24/7 for a month. Finally, the reason women would find it offensive is because it reveals unacceptable truths about the man who would be the president including his utter lack of respect for half of the electorate.

As a man, I feel the need to protect the women in my life from this guy.

It amazes me that there could still be apologists for Trump out there. What would it take to realize this guy is not made of the material required for the presidency?

I have a 12 year old daughter who is very precious to me. I cannot let her watch the news cycle because the Republican nominee for President is a crude, vile person who demeans women, immigrants, the disabled, and entire religions.

The Republican Party used to be a serious party. With this nominee it has become contemptible. And the Evangelical Trump apologists out in full force this morning are even worse.

I thought Clinton went too far in her "basket of deplorable" comments. Now I am genuinely not sure. We'll see how strong Trump's support remains. Is the electorate supporting Trump absolutely blind or do they share his deplorable views of women and condone sexual assault? It's that simple.

Oh really, these are the types of conversations men have in private?

Strange, many of us have been a part of the "men in business suits" club for decades, and spent plenty of time in the old days in places like "scores" where men could watch strippers dance while downing a beer and watching televised knick games ...

A typical conversation might involve comments on how "hot" one or more women are, however, in my experience it was only the most depraved and obnoxious men who might boast about making it with married women. I'd be willing to bet that most men have never even heard another man boast about grabbing a woman by the genitals.

No, you are wrong here, these were not at all the typical remarks among men in private, and not even among men in strip clubs. These remarks have the hallmark of that certain type of individual -- who is more vain, narcissistic and, actually cruel -- than most guys.
